title: Vote NOW to decide who will be your VisitEngland and Mirror Travel Tourism Superstar of 2017

organizations.name: hull & east yorkshire leye d johns

text:
Vote NOW to decide who will be your VisitEngland and Mirror Travel Tourism Superstar of 2017 Which of our 10 fantastic finalists will be this year's winner of our prestigious holiday hero award? Have your say and vote now to choose who will be the country's Tourism Superstar for 2017 Share Comments By Nigel Thompson 08:00, 7 FEB 2017 Updated 14:00, 7 FEB 2017 Lifestyle Fears of a leaky EU revealed by quitting EU ambas Quitting EU ambassador Sir Ivan Rogers preempts " 1:30 Dramatic moment boy is saved from choking by his 0:55 Tory rebellion threat forces government to make B 0:55 Joly de Lotbiniere appears on University Challenge 0:37 Son's emotional story of mum's cancer journey 2:24 Return to winter weather for the UK 0:49 Woman goes through windscreen when driver's shoe 0:23 Russell Square killer stalks streets with knife 0:49 Little girl told she has a year to live after her 2:08 Friends and family searched for clues as to Celes 0:47 Video will play in Meet the contenders for VisitEngland's Tourism Superstar competition Share Comments Get daily Vote for your holiday hero of 2017 now!
The prestigious award was launched by tourist board VisitEngland and Mirror Travel six years ago and celebrates the unsung heroes within the tourism industry who far exceed the call of duty to ensure visitors have an amazing experience.
Local tourist boards across the country submitted hundreds of nominations and our judges have drawn up this shortlist of 10 candidates – including one pair - for you to vote on.
Our finalists have made brief video presentations on what they do and why they should win.
All you have to do is watch the video and then vote on the form below. You can only vote once
Our winner will be announced during English Tourism Week (March 25- April 2).
The finalists are:
Gemma Garwood, Falmouth Town Crier, Cornwall Peter Jay, Volunteer, Cotswold Water Park Trust Gillian Scotford and Jane Carver, co-founders of Accessible Derbyshire Karl Gibson, landlord, Ye Olde Trip to Jerusalem, Nottingham Duane Dibartolomeo, Owner, Grosvenor Fish Bar, Norwich Kevin Robson, tour guide and owner, Wild Dog Outdoors, Northumberland Alan Anderson, park ranger, Auckland Castle, Durham Liz Hill, founder, Rural Concierge, Herefordshire Paul Schofield, city tour guide, Hull & East Yorkshire Leye D Johns, host & compere, Viva Blackpool Read More Meet the 10 fantastic finalists for the 2017 Mirror Travel and VisitEngland Tourism Superstar award The 2016 Tourism Superstar winner Lilian Groves Read More Your 2016 Tourism Superstar is revealed as Durham Cathedral's Lilian Groves - with a little help from Sting Keep up with with how the vote is progressing on Twitter via @MirrorTravelEd @MirrorTravel @VisitEngland @VisitEnglandBiz or the hashtag #TourismSuperstar - and watch for vote updates and news online here and in the Daily Mirror's travel pages every Saturday.
The winner will receive their prize at the VisitEngland Awards for Excellence gala in London on April 24.
Last year’s winner was Lilian Groves, senior guide at Durham Cathedral.
More info at visitengland.com englishtourismweek.co.uk
